catch_line: COUNCIL NOT TO INTERFERE IN APPOINTMENTS OR REMOVALS BY CITY MANAGER.

1.name: ARTICLE III. - APPOINTMENT AND REMOVAL OF OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES; INTEREST OF OFFICIALS IN CONTRACTS
1.label: article

full_text: Neither the City Council nor any of its members shall direct or request the appointment of any person to, or his removal from, office by the City Manager or by any of his subordinates, or in any manner take part in the appointment or removal of officers and employees in the administrative service of the City. Except for the purpose of inquiry, the Council and its members shall deal with the administrative service solely through the City Manager and neither the Council nor any member thereof shall give orders to any subordinates of the City Manager, either publicly or privately.

Except for the purpose of inquiry, the Council and its members shall deal with the administrative service solely through the City Manager and neither the Council nor any member thereof shall give orders to any subordinates of the City Manager, either publicly or privately.

dublin_core.Title: COUNCIL NOT TO INTERFERE IN APPOINTMENTS OR REMOVALS BY CITY MANAGER.

plain_text:
CODE OF STATE

COUNCIL NOT TO INTERFERE IN APPOINTMENTS OR REMOVALS BY CITY MANAGER. (§
I-III-3.6)

Neither the City Council nor any of its members shall direct or request the
appointment of any person to, or his removal from, office by the City Manager or
by any of his subordinates, or in any manner take part in the appointment or
removal of officers and employees in the administrative service of the City.
Except for the purpose of inquiry, the Council and its members shall deal with
the administrative service solely through the City Manager and neither the
Council nor any member thereof shall give orders to any subordinates of the City
Manager, either publicly or privately.
